Title: A new urticarial rash, diarrhoea and refractory hypotension in a man with a history of migraines
Source: Clin. Med. J. R. Coll. Phys. Lond.
Abstract: © Royal College of Physicians 2016. All rights reserved.We present the case of a man with a history of migraines treated with propanolol, referred with a rash, diarrhoea, vomiting and hypotension. Our case highlights how prior betablocker use may prolong anaphylaxis and cause refractory hypotension.
